attributes.action: Allow both parents to be with their child in hospital.
attributes.additional_details: During covid only one parent have been allowed to be with their child in hospital. No family should have to go through this and suffer the trauma this brings. Parents have the legal right to be with their child.
attributes.background: Allow two parents/care givers into Hospital with their child. Whether that is as an inpatient or outpatient.

rejection.details:
It’s about something that the UK Government or Parliament is not directly responsible for.

Visiting policies for individual hospitals are a matter for NHS England and individual NHS trusts, not the Government or Parliament. You should contact your local hospital to find out what their visiting policy is.

If you're concerned about the quality of care being received, you can find out how to raise this here

https://www.nhs.uk/using-the-nhs/about-the-nhs/how-to-complain-to-the-nhs/
